definition: lit. secondary foreigner/(derogatory term for Chinese Christians and others associated with foreigners, used at the time of the Boxer Rebellion)/(coll.) westernized Chinese person/(derog.) person of mixed Chinese and Russian blood/(slang) Ukraine/German shepherd dog/(dialect) two-year-old goat

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
foreign religion (esp. Western Christianity in Qing China)
foreign devil/term of abuse for Westerners
the Righteous and Harmonious Fists/the Boxers (history)
the Righteous and Harmonious Fists/the Boxers (history)
(Wu dialect) bum/wretched-looking tramp who lives by begging or stealing
Support the Qing, annihilate the West! (Boxer rebellion slogan)
devils/refers to 日本鬼子, wartime term insult for Japanese
